SIFToolkit.standardTemplateColor.name: Standard Spell Template Border Color
SIFToolkit.standardTemplateColor.hint: Template border color for standard spells (no duration or concentration), as a hex string (rrggbb)
SIFToolkit.concentrationTemplateColor.hi: Template border color for spells requiring concentration, as a hex string (rrggbb)
SIFToolkit.enduringTemplateColor.name: Enduring Spell Template Border Color
SIFToolkit.enduringTemplateColor.hint: Template border color for spells with a duration greater than instantaneous, that do not require concentration, as a hex string (rrggbb)
SIFToolkit.specialTemplateColor.name: Special Spell Template Border Color
SIFToolkit.specialTemplateColor.hint: Template border color for spells with a special duration (typically a trigger), that do not require concentration, as a hex string (rrggbb)
SIFToolkit.unmanagedTemplateAction.name: Unmanaged Template Action
SIFToolkit.unmanagedTemplateAction.hint: What should Spell Template Manager do for unmanaged spell templates?
SIFToolkit.instantaneousSpellFade.name: Instantaneous Spell Fade Duration
SIFToolkit.instantaneousSpellFade.hint: Number of additional rounds to display instantaneous spell templates
SIFToolkit.worldConcentration.name: Maintain concentration across scenes
SIFToolkit.worldConcentration.hint: Check to end concentration templates on all scenes whenever a concentration spell is cast
SIFToolkit.usingAT.name: Use About Time for template timeout processing
SIFToolkit.usingAT.hint: Checking this box will disable STM processing and offload to the About Time module
SIFToolkit.enforceConcentration.name: Enforce Concentration
SIFToolkit.enforceConcentration.hint: If enabled, will remove old concentration templates if a new concentration template is placed
SIFToolkit.timeProcessor.name: Time Processor
SIFToolkit.timeProcessor.hint: Select the module that will manage how lasting effects expire
SIFToolkit.messageHistory.name: Message History Count
SIFToolkit.messageHistory.hint: Select the number of actionable chat messages that SIFToolkit will keep track of
